title: Data for "Optimal Obfuscation: Democracy and Trade Policy Transparency"
description:
Description
A data set for replicating an argument about the relationship between democracy
and tariffs/non-tariff trade barriers.
reference:
Data downloaded Joshua Alley's Github repository on simple cross-sectional
OLS models. These were originally two separate Stata files that I merged into one.
Please read the Kono (2006) article for more information.

parameters.country: a character vector for the country
parameters.iec: the index of electoral competitiveness from the World Bank
parameters.tariff: the mean statutory most favored nation tariff rate
parameters.polity: the familiar Polity measure of democracy, from -10 to 10
parameters.dimpgdp: the change in the import/GDP ratio over the past three years
parameters.avgtar: the country's average most favored nation tariff rate
parameters.qualcov: the quality non-tariff barrier coverate ratio
parameters.gatt: a dummy variable for GATT membership
parameters.lngovcons: the log of country's government consumption spending as a percentage of GDP
parameters.isocode: a character vector for the three-character ISO code of the country
parameters.corecov: the core non-tariff barrier coverage ratio
parameters.lngdppc: real GDP per capita in 1995 dollars

format: A data frame with 75 observations on the following 16 variables.
